messages.content: :awaken:
hey guys just woke up, what card are we talking about today?
Awaken
haha wow how ironic
anyways
would you like healing + death prevention in your deck? if so, enjoy
probably one of the best options if you're hail marying a boss card pot
I take this from quick study
Or boss pot
i'd like something that immediately solves a combat a little more, but yeah you cant go wrong with an extra life and/or self repair
in my experience (mostly with guardian), if you have this your run is probably not ending anywhere other than a boss
even if the death triggers you can usually use that death turn to dish out tons of damage and end the fight soon after the hit
when it was bugged to heal twice if you died, that was legit
oh yeah im talking about the context of getting this from a boss pot or a "choose a boss card" card
im just talking in general
yeah this shit good
kinda funny when you think about it
in most cases this can just say "heal 8 hp"
tho i guess survivng one big hit no matter what is pretty impactful
i wonder if "lose this buff" is even necessary in the wording
"Next time you would die, or when combat ends, heal 8 HP instead."
so it's either an expensive self repair, or a janky buffer
2 bandage up at 2 higher cost
either an expensive self repair or a fairy in a bottle
it's probably the most generically useful boss card
hell yeah give me an all-class repair
dont even care that it costs 2
it heals more than self repair does when upgraded
that healing twice thing was a bug right?
oh yeah scrolled up
I mostly save boss potions for aoe elite fights because of automabeam and you are mine
prepare crush is also good because its a fire potion glued onto a block potion
yep same
as a "hail mary" boss potion i'm almost always going to want to get automabeam because there aren't a lot of situations that card (as 0-cost no less) doesn't immediately solve
if red slaver is dead I am happy
this card sucks because I don't die 😎 😎
its alright for preventing death in the first place though, its basically a 2 energy self repair; which is valuable on characters that lack healing cards entirely

this is most noticeable for gremlins since 8 HP heals half of a gremlins health bar and if you dead draw because you drew awakened, at least it revives you. It also helps Snecko a lot, since you can make awakened cheaper most of the time and you can always appreciate having recovery encase of bad RNG getting you injured

on the flip side, this card is pretty awful for hexaghost since it already has a self repair clone in first seal and can find that card much more easily with 3rd and 6th seals. Slime boss also does not want this much since slime boss has cards that heal more then 8 and do damage for the same energy cost
its not completely awful on hexaghost, if I was bleeding a lot and found this in my sensory stone options I would consider it because the block from the bolster could offset the cost
I would not buy it in a shop though
actually makes me wonder if it would be good on gremlins
<short stature>

embeds.title: Runic Capacitor
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Start each combat with 3 additional Orb slots.
*More is better.*

messages.content: cries?
they would want to find a blind then
95% chance it does nothing, that was the joke lol
I know

It's a self-repair variant that can be taken on any downfall character, which can be very helpful for those without sustain in their kit. It is fairly expensive at 2 energy, and that makes the healing less efficient. It also can help you survive one big hit (though multi-hits will carry through and likely kill you), which is a nice additional mode to have. One of self repairs biggest downsides is that it does nothing if you can't actually survive the fight, which can happen as defect is often slow to setup, and this card manages to avoid that drawback. If watcher was one of your act bosses, you could try to use a copy of awaken to tank the divinity hit on turn 8 of the neow fight. Automaton, slime boss, collector and hexaghost all have their own self-healing cards (most of which are better). This is likely too slow for champ. Guardian is fairly happy with this, as they tend to be a bit slow and need some time to set up stasis, so having a way to heal chip damage is nice. This is a lot of health for gremlins to get back proportionally, but they usually don't want to play slow cards like this. Snecko really benefits, as it's offclass and a good muddle target. 

Gets a lot better once you have 4 energy, as spending 2/3rds of a turn on this is likely to lose you more health than it heals in the early game. Gets much better with any way to reduce its cost like snecko eye or mummified hand. Runic pyramid can let you hold onto this until you find a safe turn to cast it. Upgrade is pretty good, a +4 on a 2 energy card that helps provide even more sustain. I feel like this could deserve a slight buff, as the healing does feel quite inefficient next to other options, though the utility of the resurrection effect is powerful.
<reprieve>
